--- title: "Learning to Love Regexes By Learning Them" subtitle: "I Promised Myself I Wouldn't Do This Again" description: "Building a regex generator for self-contained, well-defined string detection problems is a very effective way to learn regular expressions." format: html: reference-location: margin other-links: - text: Regex Cheatsheet icon: bookmark-plus href: https://github.com/raredd/regex - text: RexEgg icon: bookmark-plus href: https://www.rexegg.com/ - text: Regex in R icon: bookmark-plus href: https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/base/html/regex.html editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ::: {.cell} ::: # HCPCS ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} `````{=html} 
                 Count                                   Regex
All              18903 (^[A-CEGHJ-MP-V0-9][0-9]{3}[AFMTU0-9]$)
 Level I         10985                  (^[0-9]{4}[AFMTU0-9]$)
  Category I      9990                    (^[0-9]{4}[AMU0-9]$)
  Category II      565                           (^[0-9]{4}F$)
  Category III     430                           (^[0-9]{4}T$)
 Level II         7918              (^[A-CEGHJ-MP-V][0-9]{4}$)
````` ::: # TODO * ~~If a **wildcard** begins with a **letter**, the *postfix* should be `[0-9]{n}`.~~ * Eliminate `g1()` step in grouping. * In `remove_redundant()`, try pmap for `rr()` step. ## Checklist - [X] `split_lengths()` - [X] `remove_redundant()` - [ ] `process_groups()` - [X] `g1()` - [X] `g2()` - [ ] `g3()` - [ ] `g4()` - [ ] `g5()` - [ ] `reduce_groups()` # Helpers ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} sort_order <- \(x) { sort <- stringr::str_sort(x, numeric = TRUE) alph <- stringr::str_extract_all(sort, stringr::regex("[A-Z]")) numb <- stringr::str_extract_all(sort, stringr::regex("[0-9]")) alph <- purrr::list_c(alph) numb <- purrr::list_c(numb) paste0( paste0(alph, collapse = ""), paste0(numb, collapse = "") ) } ``` ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} # collapse unique_vlength <- \(x) collapse::funique(collapse::vlengths(x, use.names = FALSE)) unique_narm <- \(x) collapse::funique(collapse::na_rm(x)) max_vlength <- \(x) collapse::fmax(collapse::vlengths(x, use.names = FALSE)) # vctrs empty <- \(x) vctrs::vec_is_empty(x) chop <- \(v, g) vctrs::vec_chop(v, sizes = vctrs::vec_run_sizes(g)) # stringfish take_at <- \(x, i = 1) stringfish::sf_substr(x, start = i, stop = i, nthreads = 4L) detect_az <- \(x) x[stringfish::sf_grepl(x, "[A-Z]{1}", nthreads = 4L)] ``` ::: ## View ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} cutoff <- \(x) stringr::str_trunc(string = x, width = 40, side = "right") wrap <- \(x) stringr::str_wrap(string = x, width = 60, exdent = 5, whitespace_only = FALSE) view <- \(x) { idx <- seq_along(x) len <- collapse::vlengths(x, use.names = FALSE) tree <- unname(purrr::map_vec(x, paste0, collapse = " ")) |> purrr::map_vec(cutoff) cat( glue::glue( "{format(idx)}: ", "{format(len)}|", "--[{if (empty(tree)) NULL else format(tree, justify = 'none')}]" ), sep = "\n") } view_remove <- \(x) { len <- length(x) tree <- unname(paste0(x, collapse = " ")) |> purrr::map_vec(cutoff) cat( glue::glue( "Removed ", "{format(len, justify = 'left')}|", "--[{if (empty(tree)) NULL else format(tree, justify = 'none')}]" ), sep = "\n") } ``` ::: # Preprocessing ## `split_lengths()` ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} split_lengths <- function(x, verbose = TRUE) { stopifnot(is.character(x)) x <- stringfish::sf_gsub(x, "\\*|\\s", "", nthreads = 4L) |> unique_narm() |> stringr::str_sort() l <- collapse::vlengths(x) out <- list( x1 = x[l == 1], x2 = x[l == 2], x3 = x[l == 3], x4 = x[l == 4], x5 = x[l == 5]) if (verbose) { cat("* Split By Lengths:", sep = "\n") cat(view(out), sep = "\n") return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } codex::random_hcpcs(n = 5) |> split_lengths() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` * Split By Lengths: 1: 2|--[0 G] 2: 5|--[04 43 89 G8 K0] 3: 5|--[058 376 875 A02 J30] 4: 5|--[0733 1592 8020 C944 J071] 5: 5|--[28261 42507 A0100 E0433 J2794] ``` ::: ::: ## `remove_redundant()` If a vector contains both `"A"` and `"A0"`, remove `"A0"`. Codes that contain a common sub-string can be simplified, in turn simplifying the eventual regex output. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} contrast <- \(long, short) { if (empty(long)) return(character(0)) if (empty(short)) return(long) end <- unique_vlength(short) ldx <- stringfish::sf_substr(long, 1, end, nthreads = 4L) long[!ldx %in% short] } rr <- contrast ``` ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} remove_redundant <- function(x, verbose = TRUE) { .c(x1, x2, x3, x4, x5) %=% x out <- list( x1 = x1, x2 = rr(x2, x1), x3 = rr(x3, x1) |> rr(x2), x4 = rr(x4, x1) |> rr(x2) |> rr(x3), x5 = rr(x5, x1) |> rr(x2) |> rr(x3) |> rr(x4) ) if (verbose) { # cli::cat_boxx(label = paste0("Group 3", cli::symbol$record), align = "left", padding = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) cat("<===||Remove Redundancies||:::||", sep = "\n") cat(view(out), sep = "\n") return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } codex::random_hcpcs(15) |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` * Split By Lengths: 1: 5|--[6 F L P Q] 2: 12|--[00 27 56 61 64 69 93 G2 G9 K0 L3 Q4] 3: 14|--[004 032 172 226 243 272 598 923 929 G...] 4: 15|--[0034 2066 2124 2661 4323 8925 9073 92...] 5: 15|--[0344T 1160F 23078 4010F 43848 84228 9...] <===||Remove Redundancies||:::|| 1: 5|--[6 F L P Q] 2: 7|--[00 27 56 93 G2 G9 K0] 3: 9|--[032 172 226 243 598 923 929 G00 S40] 4: 9|--[2066 2124 2661 4323 8925 9073 A653 J9...] 5: 10|--[0344T 1160F 23078 4010F 43848 84228 9...] ``` ::: ::: # Grouping Group each set of vectors into regex patterns. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} lump <- function(x, threshold = 3) { stopifnot(is.numeric(x)) xo <- order(x) xs <- x[xo] dlag <- abs(c(0, xs[-1] - xs[seq_along(xs) - 1])) bi <- ifelse(dlag >= threshold, 1, 0) id <- cumsum(bi) + 1 id[xo] } ``` ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} letters_2_numbers <- \(x) { look <- rlang::set_names( seq_along(LETTERS), LETTERS) unname(look[detect_az(x)]) } ``` ::: ::: {.panel-tabset} ## [g1|g2] ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} g1 <- function(x, verbose = TRUE) { x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "x1") if (empty(x)) return(character(0)) out <- list(x) if (verbose) { cat("** Group 1:", sep = "\n") cat(view(out), sep = "\n") return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } g2 <- function(x, verbose = TRUE) { x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "x2") if (empty(x)) return(character(0)) out <- collapse::rsplit(x, take_at(x, 1), use.names = FALSE) if (verbose) { cat("** Group 2:", sep = "\n") cat(view(out), sep = "\n") return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } codex::random_hcpcs() |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> g1() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` * Split By Lengths: 1: 1|--[Q] 2: 10|--[00 25 28 45 84 88 G0 G8 J2 T1] 3: 9|--[004 101 241 781 922 959 G04 G94 K08] 4: 10|--[0721 2093 6482 6922 8648 8665 9068 G8...] 5: 10|--[0757T 0801T 15110 56740 78811 A4233 G...] <===||Remove Redundancies||:::|| 1: 1|--[Q] 2: 10|--[00 25 28 45 84 88 G0 G8 J2 T1] 3: 7|--[101 241 781 922 959 G94 K08] 4: 9|--[0721 2093 6482 6922 8648 8665 9068 J9...] 5: 9|--[0757T 0801T 15110 56740 78811 A4233 G...] ** Group 1: 1: 1|--[Q] ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} codex::random_hcpcs(25) |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> g2() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` * "L80" # $f # [1] "L56" "L59" # # ^L(5[69]|80)$ stringfish::sf_grepl( c("L6789", "L8000", "L5600", "L5900"), "^L(5[69]|80)[0-9]{2}$" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] FALSE TRUE TRUE TRUE ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} group_hcpcs_3 <- function(x) { x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "x3") if (empty(x)) return(character(0)) base <- data.table::data.table( code = x, a1 = take_at(x, 1), a2 = take_at(x, 2), a3 = take_at(x, 3)) indices <- base |> dplyr::mutate(i1 = dplyr::consecutive_id(a1)) |> dplyr::mutate(i2 = dplyr::consecutive_id(a2), .by = a1) |> dplyr::mutate(i3 = dplyr::consecutive_id(a3), .by = c(a1, a2)) orphans <- indices |> dplyr::add_count(i1, name = "n1", sort = TRUE) |> dplyr::filter((i2 + i3 + n1) == 3) |> dplyr::pull(code) last <- indices |> dplyr::filter(!code %in% orphans) |> dplyr::select(code, a1:a3) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1"), sep = "") last <- dplyr::left_join( last |> dplyr::count(group_id, a2), last |> dplyr::count(group_id, name = "g"), by = dplyr::join_by(group_id)) |> dplyr::filter(n == g) |> dplyr::right_join(last, by = dplyr::join_by(group_id, a2)) |> dplyr::filter(!is.na(n)) rest <- indices |> dplyr::filter(!code %in% c(orphans, dplyr::pull(last, code))) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1", "a2"), sep = "") grouped <- vctrs::vec_c( vctrs::vec_chop(last$code, sizes = vctrs::vec_run_sizes(last$group_id)), vctrs::vec_chop(rest$code, sizes = vctrs::vec_run_sizes(rest$group_id)) ) o <- unlist(grouped[which(collapse::vlengths(grouped) == 1)]) out <- vctrs::vec_c( set_names(as.list(orphans), rep("o", length(orphans))), set_names(chop(o, dplyr::consecutive_id(take_at(o, 1))), rep("r", length(chop(o, dplyr::consecutive_id(take_at(o, 1)))))), set_names(grouped[which(collapse::vlengths(grouped) != 1)], rep("f", length(grouped[which(collapse::vlengths(grouped) != 1)]))) ) out[collapse::radixorderv(collapse::vlengths(out), sort = TRUE)] } # collapse::get_elem(x, "r", regex = TRUE) # collapse::get_elem(x, "o", regex = TRUE) # collapse::get_elem(x, "f", regex = TRUE) codex::random_hcpcs(30) |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> group_hcpcs_3() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` * Split By Lengths: 1: 3|--[6 C P] 2: 24|--[00 30 37 49 62 73 80 92 A6 A9 C9 D5 E...] 3: 30|--[016 035 157 221 222 265 275 298 429 5...] ```{.r .cell-code} reduce_runs <- function(x) { ad <- c(LETTERS, 0:9) vec <- rlang::set_names(rep(0, 36), ad) vec2 <- vec[fuimus::splitter(x)] vec2 <- vec2[!is.na(vec2)] vec[names(vec2)] <- 1 vec_group <- dplyr::tibble( value = names(vec), key = vec, idx = seq_along(vec), group = dplyr::consecutive_id(key)) |> dplyr::mutate(group_size = dplyr::n(), .by = group) |> dplyr::filter(key == 1, group_size >= 3) |> dplyr::select(value, group) if (empty(vec_group)) return(x) xgroups <- chop(vec_group$value, vec_group$group) |> purrr::map(fuimus::collapser) |> purrr::list_c() if (all(xgroups == paste0(ad, collapse = ""))) return("[A-Z0-9]") replacements <- dplyr::left_join( dplyr::slice_min(vec_group, by = group, order_by = value) |> dplyr::rename(start = value), dplyr::slice_max(vec_group, by = group, order_by = value) |> dplyr::rename(end = value), by = dplyr::join_by(group)) |> glue::glue_data("{start}-{end}") |> as.vector() res <- stringi::stri_replace_all_regex(x, xgroups, replacements, vectorize_all = FALSE) paste0("[", res, "]") } ``` ::: ## G == 1 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} p1 <- function(x) { if (empty(x[["g1"]])) return(character(0)) x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "g1")[[1]] re <- sort_order(x) |> reduce_runs() if (re == "[A-Z0-9]") return(glue::glue("^{re}{{5}}$")) postfix <- ifelse(stringfish::sf_grepl(re, "\\[?[0-9]{1}", nthreads = 4L), "[A-Z0-9]", "[0-9]") glue::glue("^{re}{postfix}{{4}}$") } hcpcs_tests |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> process_groups() |> p1() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` * Split By
